de.mrapp.textmining.util.metrics

Interface TextMetric

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiceCoefficient, HammingAccuracy, HammingDistance, HammingLoss, LevenshteinDissimilarity, LevenshteinDistance, LevenshteinSimilarity

    public interface TextMetric
    Defines the interface, a metric, which allows to calculate heuristic values, which specify the similarity or dissimilarity of texts, must implement.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double evaluate(@NotNull java.lang.String text1, @NotNull java.lang.String text2)
      Calculates the heuristic value of two texts according to the metric.
      boolean isGainMetric()
      Returns, whether the metric is a gain metric, i.e.
      double maxValue()
      Returns the maximum heuristic value, which is possibly calculated by the metric.
      double minValue()
      Returns the minimum heuristic value, which is possibly calculated by the metric.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        double evaluate(@NotNull
                @NotNull java.lang.String text1,
                @NotNull
                @NotNull java.lang.String text2)
        Calculates the heuristic value of two texts according to the metric.
        Parameters:
        text1 - The first text as a String
        text2 - The second text as a String
        Returns:
        The heuristic value, which has been calculated, as a Double value. The heuristic value is at least minValue() and at maximum maxValue()

      • minValue

        double minValue()
        Returns the minimum heuristic value, which is possibly calculated by the metric.
        Returns:
        The minimum heuristic value, which is possible calculated by the metric as a Double value

      • maxValue

        double maxValue()
        Returns the maximum heuristic value, which is possibly calculated by the metric.
        Returns:
        The maximum heuristic value, which is possibly calculated by the metric, as a Double value

      • isGainMetric

        boolean isGainMetric()
        Returns, whether the metric is a gain metric, i.e. that two strings that evaluate to a greater heuristic value are considered to be more similar than two strings that evaluate to a smaller heuristic value.
        Returns:
        True, if the gain metric is a gain metric, false, if the metric is a loss metric
